archdesc.runner: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.unittitle: Bruce Family Papers, 1746-1905, n.d.
did.physdesc: This holding consists of ca. 330 items.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Bruce Family Papers, Accession # 2692, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This item was acquired as a gift on December 16, 1963.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, journals, and account books of James Bruce and his son, James Cole Bruce, of Berry Hill, Halifax County. There are lists of slaves, e.g., a November 22, 1849, list and inventory of slaves on the plantation of Messrs. Bruce, Seddon, and Williams and an 1852 "Register of Negroes," plus many entries in the account books and other material relating to slavery.
